name: give-me-hours
description: A command-line tool to list out hours worked based on git log hours in a working directory.

commands.title: Give Me Hours: Open Welcome Page

giveMeHours.workingDirectory.description: The folder containing your git repositories. Use the 'Select Folder' button in the extension or set this path manually.
giveMeHours.workingDirectory.markdownDescription: The folder containing your git repositories. Use the **Select Folder** button in the extension or set this path manually.

giveMeHours.duration.description: Maximum gap between commits to count as continuous work. Examples: '1h' (1 hour), '30m' (30 minutes), '90s' (90 seconds)
giveMeHours.duration.patternErrorMessage: Duration must be a number followed by 'h' (hours), 'm' (minutes), or 's' (seconds). Examples: '1h', '30m', '90s'

giveMeHours.hoursRounding.description: Round up hours to nearest increment. 0.25 = 15 minutes, 0.5 = 30 minutes, 1 = 1 hour. Set to 0 to disable rounding.
giveMeHours.hoursRounding.markdownDescription:
Round up hours to nearest increment:
- `0.25` = 15 minutes
- `0.5` = 30 minutes
- `1` = 1 hour
- `0` = disable rounding

giveMeHours.projectStartupTime.description: Add time before each work session in hours for project startup/setup. 0.5 = 30 minutes of setup/thinking time. Set to 0 to disable.
giveMeHours.projectStartupTime.markdownDescription:
Add time before each work session in hours for project startup/setup:
- `0.5` = 30 minutes (default)
- `1` = 1 hour
- `0` = no startup time

giveMeHours.minCommitTime.description: Minimum time credited for a single commit or a commit after a long break, in hours. 0.5 = 30 minutes.
giveMeHours.minCommitTime.markdownDescription: Minimum time credited for a single commit or a commit after a long break, in hours. `0.5` = 30 minutes.

giveMeHours.words.description: Maximum number of words to show in commit summaries. Longer summaries will be truncated with '...'

giveMeHours.showSummary.description: Show commit summary column in the results table. You can also toggle this using the button in the extension.

giveMeHours.dataType.description: Choose the data type for calculating hours. 'Rounded' includes rounding and startup time, while 'Clean' shows the raw calculated hours.
giveMeHours.dataType.markdownDescription:
Choose the data type for calculating hours:
- `rounded`: Includes rounding and project startup time (default).
- `clean`: Shows the raw, unadjusted calculated hours.

giveMeHours.timeFormat.description: Choose the time format for displaying hours. 'Decimal' shows hours as a decimal number (e.g., 1.5), while 'Chrono' shows hours and minutes (e.g., 1:30).
giveMeHours.timeFormat.markdownDescription:
Choose the time format for displaying hours:
- `decimal`: Shows hours as a decimal number (e.g., 1.5) (default).
- `chrono`: Shows hours and minutes (e.g., 1:30).
